label: 雅楽
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Court music of an ensemble featuring transverse flutes (fue, more accurately ryūteki and komabue), a double-reed oboe-like instrument (hichiriki), a free-reed mouth organ (shō), a four-stringed lute played with a large plectrum (biwa), and other string and percussion instruments. Music by this ensemble (without strings) was often used to accompany dance (bugaku).［笛、龍笛、駒笛、篳篥、笙、琵琶、舞楽］
